question: On the Day of Atonement, what did the high priest do with the scapegoat?
explanation: The scapegoat carried the people's sins into the wilderness, symbolizing their removal.

verses.kjv: And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.

question: What were Israelites commanded to do every seventh year?
explanation: Every seventh year was a Sabbath for the land, when fields were not to be sown or reaped.

verses.kjv: But in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the LORD: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.

question: What festival celebrates the giving of the Law at Mount Sinai?
explanation: Pentecost, occurring 50 days after Passover, commemorates when God gave the Law at Sinai.

verses.kjv:
In the third month, when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they
into the wilderness of Sinai.

question: What was the Year of Jubilee?
choices: Every 50th year when slaves were freed and land returned
The year the king was crowned
explanation: The 50th year was the Year of Jubilee when liberty was proclaimed, slaves freed, and property returned.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout
all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

question: What was the Feast of Trumpets?
choices: A day of rest and sacred assembly
explanation: The first day of the seventh month was to be a day of sabbath rest, commemorated with trumpet blasts.

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first
day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

question: What does the Hebrew word 'Selah' in Psalms likely mean?
explanation: Selah appears throughout the Psalms and is thought to indicate a pause for reflection or a musical interlude.

verses.kjv:
Many
there be which say of my soul,
There is no help for him in God. Selah.

question: What did the high priest wear on his breastplate?
explanation: Mount four rows of precious stones on the breastplate, representing the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv:
And thou shalt set in it settings of stones,
even four rows of stones:
the first row
shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle:
this shall be the first row.
And the second row
shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
And the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.
And the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names,
like the engravings of a signet; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.

question: What was the purpose of the Year of Jubilee?
choices: To free slaves and return property
explanation: Consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout
all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

question: What was the scapegoat in the Day of Atonement ceremony?
choices: A goat sent into the wilderness bearing sins
explanation: The goat chosen by lot as the scapegoat shall be sent into the wilderness to take away the sins of the people.

verses.kjv:
But the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the LORD, to make an atonement with him,
and
 to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.

question: What did Jews wear to remind them of God's commandments?
explanation: Make tassels on the corners of your garments to help you remember all the commands of the Lord.

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:
And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the LORD, and do them; and that ye seek not after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a whoring:

question: What is the Feast of Tabernacles also called?
explanation: Say to the Israelites: 'On the fifteenth day of the seventh month the Lord's Festival of Tabernacles begins.'

verses.kjv:
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month
shall be the feast of tabernacles
for seven days unto the LORD.

question: What is Pentecost also called?
explanation: Count off seven weeks from the day after the Sabbath until the Feast of Weeks.

verses.kjv: And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:

question: How often was the Year of Jubilee celebrated?
explanation: Consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty throughout the land.

verses.kjv:
And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout
all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubile unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

question: What did Jews write on their doorposts?
explanation: Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt write them upon the posts of thy house, and on thy gates.

question: What was the Sabbath day journey limit?
explanation: Then the apostles returned to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day's walk from the city.

verses.kjv: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day’s journey.

question: What were Jews required to do every seventh year regarding debts?
explanation: At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.

verses.kjv:
At the end of
every seven years thou shalt make a release.
And this
is the manner of the release: Every creditor that lendeth
ought unto his neighbour shall release
it; he shall not exact
it of his neighbour, or of his brother; because it is called the LORD’S release.

question: What were Jews commanded to wear on the corners of their garments?
explanation: Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'Make tassels on the corners of your garments.'

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:

question: What were Israelite men required to appear before the Lord with three times a year?
explanation: Three times a year all the men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord.

verses.kjv: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord GOD.

question: What month was Passover celebrated?
explanation: This month is to be for you the first month, the first month of your year.

verses.kjv:
This month
shall be unto you the beginning of months: it
shall be the first month of the year to you.

question: On what day of the month was Passover celebrated?
explanation: Take care of them until the fourteenth day of the month, when all the members of the community of Israel must slaughter them at twilight.

verses.kjv: And ye shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.

question: How were the Israelites to eat the Passover meal?
choices: With cloak tucked in, sandals on, and staff in hand
explanation: This is how you are to eat it: with your cloak tucked into your belt, your sandals on your feet and your staff in your hand. Eat it in haste; it is the Lord's Passover.

question: What animal did the high priest sacrifice on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.

verses.kjv:
And Aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin offering, which
is
 for himself, and shall make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin offering which
is for himself:

question: What was the name of the scapegoat on the Day of Atonement?
explanation: But the goat chosen by lot as the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the Lord to be used for making atonement by sending it into the wilderness as a scapegoat to Azazel.

verses.kjv:
But the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the LORD, to make an atonement with him,
and
 to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.
